page.title: 01Local History
page.content: Netherton is a small quiet village. Because of the mechanisation of farming this century, there has been a big loss in population from about 160 in 1851 to about 60 today. There is no Church.The only meeting places are the Star Inn public house and the Village Hall,built in memory of those who served in the First World War. There is only one shop - the Post Office.It sells sweets, soft-drinks,cigarettes and newspapers. The old school building and a nearby pair of cottages are used as an Expedition Centre. Two businesses in the village are Blakey's wagon haulage and petrol sales and Ford's Agricultural Contractors.
